dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Caleb -

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look you, I love thee marvelous well, but ‘tis God alone, not man, what knows who is a son of Abraham and who is not. Who is good and who is evil. Fain would I tell thee Sam sleeps in Jesus, that thou wilt, that I will, but I cannot tell thee that. None can. 19. CALEB looks down and starts fiddling with the trap again.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: But you and Mother... You have made covenant. You have a place in Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I keep an unfeigned grief for the want of grace. I can do no more. (Long pause). Caleb? CALEB keeps his eyes on the trap.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Where are these from?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Caleb, list me.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: From Indian Thom and Old Slater, when last they passed through. Move it thither.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: What did you trade? Very long pause.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thy mother’s silver cup. It is clear from CALEB’S face that this was not be traded. something to  20.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s recover the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: THOMASIN staring forward intensely. Curious. Cautious. Behind her, MERCY rides JONAS like a horse. JONAS makes G NOISES. THOMASIN stands in front of her parents’ bed. The curtain are still closed. She walks forward slowly and peeks in through some frayed holes in the curtains: KATHERINE lies on the bed, her hands clenched together, h eyes closed. She whispers an inaudible prayer. A sadder face has never been seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: THOMASIN, still affected by the sight of her mother. She carries a heavy pail of water on her head, bracing it with one hand. She can’t hold it up very well and the gro is muddy and upturned. With every step across the farmyar water sloshes out of the bucket on to her shoulders, soak her. She shudders with frustration. She puts the bucket down for a moment to wipe her cold no She picks it up again and keeps walking. She’s used to it but today it is too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN shovels dung out of the GOAT-SHED. Nanny goats b and walk by her. In the distance, THE TWINS are heard singing nursery rhym

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Jonas, Mercy! Come hither! THOMASIN keeps shoveling. Shoveling.  21.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jonas! Mercy!! More shoveling... THOMASIN stops. HOLD ON: THOMASIN. Something swells within her. She throws the shovel down i the dungheap and walks away from her work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN kneels at the spot where SAMUEL disappeared. She runs her fingers tenderly through the grass. She looks into THE WOOD. Pause. How could this have happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB & WILLIAM come upon another trap. No catch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another trap. Nothing. CALEB looks up at his father. WILLIAM turns around quickly before meeting eyes with his son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk on. CALEB is as anxious as WILLIAM is downtrodd FOWLER is not with them. WILLIAM puts his fingers in his mouth and whistles a LOUD WHISTLE.  22.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Fowler! Fowler! (whistles) Fool of an animal.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Fowler! Suddenly, FOWLER barks, running through the trees. WILLIAM and CALEB see him. THEY SEE SOMETHING ELSE RUNNING TOO. FOWLER is tracking something!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Fowler! (whistles) What is’t? FOWLER points. WILLIAM and CALEB look ahead: AN ENORMOUS LONG-LEGGED HARE HOPS OUT INTO THE CLEARING. THE HARE sits very still. ITS FUR IS COARSE AND ODD. WILLIAM gives CALEB a look instructing him to be quiet. WILLIAM barks at FOWLER:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fowler, bay it! FOWLER runs after THE HARE! He chases it in a wide circle around the clearing. Both running hard as they can. CALEB hands his father the heavy MUSKET.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Praise God. Look at the size. Make haste Caleb. Rushing, WILLIAM spills powder all over the barrel of the gun.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fie upon’t! He blows at the powder, probably not hard enough. CALEB holds the smoldering length of hemp.  23.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Father, there’s primer upon the -

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Peace now, hand me the match. The match cord goes out.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Ah! WILLIAM hold his hand out to CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: The match.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: It died.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Light it apace Caleb!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: The primer...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Caleb!! CALEB relights the matchcord and puts it in place. FOWLER chases THE HARE back to where it first appeared. THE HARE STOPS RUNNING. It breathes softly. FOWLER is panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOWLER barks at THE STRANGE HARE. CALEB can’t believe the sight! WILLIAM'S finger shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOWLER keeps barking ferociously. CALEB watches intently. THE MATCH CORD is burning steady.  24. WILLIAM pulls the trigger:

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: THE MUSKET MISFIRES IN WILLIAM’S FACE. THE HARE RUNS AWAY. WILLIAM yelps and puts his hands to his face, falling to ground.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Father! WILLIAM breathes quickly.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Father? WILLIAM turns his face into the ground and clenches his fists. His breath slackens. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Father?! WILLIAM sits up, but cannot look CALEB in the eye. CALEB puts his hand on his FATHER’S shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’ll make a catch father, I know it. WILLIAM gives in and embraces CALEB tightly for a moment. FOWLER wanders over and kisses WILLIAM’S blackened face.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: off Fowler. WILLIAM lets go of CALEB and stands, making embarrassed grunting noises to pull himself together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER AND SON walk completely defeated and empty handed. The wind whistles through the trees. The sun is still not shining.  25. CALEB notices THE VEINS ON WILLIAM'S HAND PULSING. Only the crunching of leaves beneath their feet. Crunch, crunch, crunch. CRUNCH, CRUNCH, CRUNCH. (at the same time)

dialogues.speaker: CALEB WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Caleb... Father- Pause.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Speak none of this to Mother. None. CALEB makes an ambivalent noise that sounds similar to an “Bye.” Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She -

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: (overlapping) An if -

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: An if what? Go to. I’d not suffer thee to lie. Go to. (pause. ) When we have brought her home that damnéd wolf, she will be glad on it and all shall be known. But now ‘twould be a greater burthen on her heart. She is over-wrought already. CALEB nods.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘Tis heedless to tell of this now. Heedless. (pause. )  26.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Let’s not speak on this again. CALEB nods.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Caleb?

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Aye, Father. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Now, canst thou tell your father what is... sin?

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Transgression of God’s Law.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Aye. Good. Canst tell me... ah... Canst thou tell me... CALEB looks at his father. WILLIAM'S mouth stays open for long pause. Thinking. His hypocrisy clouds his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge feral-looking BILLY GOAT, with enormous horns and black hair, bleats and grunts. He bucks wildly, kicking u muck and mud. The young twins, JONAS and MERCY, chase THE GOAT, waving sticks above their heads, laughing and singing:

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: Black Phillip, Black Phillip A crown grows out his head Black Phillip, Black Phillip To nanny queen is wed Jump to the fence post Running in the stall Black Phillip, Black Phillip King of all. THE HENS are clucking madly, flapping about. THE NANNY GO are crying. BURT, THE WORKHORSE neighs in the small half- built horse barn.  27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB AND WILLIAM, stumbling over the fence, run into the yard. WILLIAM tries to find a way to cut in and break up the commotion. CALEB flanks him.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Get thee back! Get thee back!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Phillip! Back!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: (sing) Black Phillip, Black Phillip, King of sky and land. Black Phillip, Black Phillip King of sea and sand. We are ye servants We are ye men Black Phillip eats the lions From the lions’ den.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: How now, you two! Stop this mischief! WILLIAM runs in front of THE BILLY GOAT and CALEB pulls T TWINS aside. Poultry flies wild. THE GOAT runs toward WILLIAM. WILLIAM tries to grab its back legs. He misses, nearly falling down. THE GOAT flies by, chasing the chickens into THE HOUSE KATHERINE runs out of the house, the GOAT heading toward KATHERINE shrieks. She runs to THE CHILDREN. WILLIAM AND THE GOAT run into THE HOUSE. A clatter is hea

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ope’ the gate Caleb, Ope’ the gate!  28. CALEB opens the gate. KATHERINE immediately grabs his arm tearing him out of the way. She holds him and THE TWINS c to her. WILLIAM drives THE GOAT in to his stall by his legs. THE KICKS...

dialogues.speaker: CALEB AND THE WHOLE FAMILY LOOKS AT HIM.
dialogues.text: THE BILLY GOAT is calm. He eats some fodder near WILLIAM. Chickens cluck. JONAS and MERCY laugh.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘1l have thee quiet. CALEB watches his father get up. WILLIAM looks at his wife. Her eyes are cloudy from lack sleep. She holds CALEB tightly. She’s not laughing.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Whither were you and Caleb this morn? WILLIAM rises to go towards her tenderly. She steps back and turns away from her husband. She calls: KATHERINE (CONT’D) Thomasin! WILLIAM goes toward her again.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Kate...

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Thomasin! Thomasin! THOMASIN comes running to the farmyard out of breath. KATHERINE (CONT’D) (To William) How could you disappear! (To Thomasin) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATHERINE (CONT’D) And thee! I told thee to keep watch of Jonas and Mercy.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I was and I bade them help me and they paid me no mind. I was a- getting - Beside her JONAS is pulling on MERCY’S cheek. MERCY tries to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping, calmly) Stop that.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (to Thomasin) What’s the matter with thee, Thomasin? What’s the matter with thee? Take thy father’s rags to the brook and wash em.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Tis only dung.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: They would pay me no mind -

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) And brush out his woolens. Help him! THOMASIN is shut down. KATHERINE (CONT’D) (to Caleb) My lamb. KATHERINE kisses CALEB’S head. CALEB WATCHES THOMASIN as she helps her father take off h soiled clothing. THERE IS SOMETHING TOO FAMILIAR IN THE W THOMASIN TOUCHES HER FATHER’S BODY AS SHE UNDRESSES HIM. IS INNOCENT - IT IS SUBTLE - BUT SHE IS TOO OLD FOR IT.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE SEES IT TOO.
dialogues.text: She keeps with the problem at hand:  30. KATHERINE (CONT’D) It gave me such a fright to find thee gone. (to William) I’‘ll not be left here alone. Dost hear? The morning's work is well behindhand. Where were you? Meanwhile, JONAS continues to pull at his sister’s cheek. With every tug MERCY’S eyes widen and he holds back laugh MERCY can’t take it: she lets out a scream, followed by a tearful giggle.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Jonas! Leave thy sister be!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: She likes it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: William?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Cannot a father spend Godly time with his son? JONAS gives another tug on MERCY’S cheek and she screams again.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jonas!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Father said stop it.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thomasin! MERCY laughs.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: She likes it! MERCY keeps laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Stop it!  31.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Stop it each of you! Stop it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: As you like. KATHERINE turns cold and walks toward the house. WILLIAM is stuck. He cannot tell her. CALEB looks at his father’s sad face... SUDDENLY, CALEB calls out to his mother:

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: We went to find apples! (Pause. ) WILLIAM'S face goes white.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the valley. I had thought I had seen an apple tree in the valley. Father brought the gun, for if we glanced that wolf again-

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Why did you not tell me?

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Father wanted it a surprise to cheer you, and so... but, there were none. I thought I had seen them. KATHERINE looks at CALEB and WILLIAM. She clearly doubts story. Pause. CALEB looks imploringly at her. She smiles hesitantly, and she concedes... barely.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I like you not outside the farm. Even to the valley. Dost hear me? CALEB nods “yes.”  32.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Caleb... (pause. ) Be a good lad and fetch some water for Mother. Stray not from the brook. CALEB looks knowingly at his father and runs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN AXE HEAD splits a LOG. WILLIAM chops wood furiously! He is half dressed with a l sheet wrapped round his waist like a skirt. Chop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The long dead tendrils of a WILLOW TREE hang around THOMA She wades in a small stream scrubbing her father’s shirt breeches against some rocks, quietly humming a psalm. CALEB is nearby, filling buckets with water, WATCHING HIS SISTER. THOMASIN’S apron and petticoat are tucked into her belt, EXPOSING HER BARE LEGS in the water. CALEB WATCHES HER LEGS...

dialogues.speaker: BODICE.
dialogues.text: THOMASIN shivers a bit in the cold water as she scrubs. CALEB holds the wooden bucket still in the stream and wat her work. THOMASIN LOOKS UP AND CATCHES HIS GAZE. CALEB gasps silently and looks to his chores.  33.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Why are you dallying? CALEB keeps his eyes on the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What then? CALEB slows his work again, but keeps looking down.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? THOMASIN splashes him with water.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Caleb? THOMASIN splashes him again.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Caleb? Big splash. CALEB looks up, hurt and ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I meant no harm in it. CALEB turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Caleb, I meant no harm. What’s the matter with thee? Come hither. What’s the matter? CALEB goes to THOMASIN and she takes him in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with thee? Shhh. CALEB’S eyes well-up with tears. THOMASIN strokes CALEB’S hair as he nestles up to her.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have seen no apple since we went from England. I would thou hadst found em. I so wish for one.

dialogues.speaker: GROWLING/GNAWING SOUND.
dialogues.text: They laugh a little, though CALEB tries not to. THOMASIN starts humming her psalm again, almost rocking CALEB. They stay for a long time in this innocently incestuous embrace. For once, all is calm. Suddenly, they hear something move in the tall grass and bulrushes: It’s the crackle and snap of many branches. (It sounds ve like the sound THE WITCH made when she ascended into the in the beginning of the film.) CALEB guiltily jumps out of THOMASIN’S arms.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Hear that?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Aye. The “clickety-clackety” sound again.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Who’s there? Long Pause. A child voice speaks, pretending to be old and scratchy:

dialogues.speaker: MERCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I be The Witch of the Wood.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Mercy, come out.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I be not Mercy, I be The Witch of the Wood. I have come to steal ye! Hear me stick a-flying through the trees: clickety-clackety-clickety- clakety!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Mercy!  35.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Show thyself! MERCY runs through the bulrushes...

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Clickety-clackety-clickety-clakety!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Why is’t when thou dost a wrong, I am a-washing Father's clothes like a slave, and thou art playing idle? MERCY comes out holding a long stick:

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Because Mother hates you!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Spoilt child. I’11 tell Mother you have left the farm alone.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Black Phillip saith I can do what I like.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Devil take your Black Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: It’s your fault I cannot leave the yard.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Quiet thee.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: I could go to the brook before you let The Witch take Sam.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: It was a wolf stole Sam.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: A witch. I’ve seen her in her riding cloak about The Wood!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Father showed me the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: It was a witch!!  36.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Aye. It was a witch, Mercy. You speak aright.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Thomasin!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: It was I!

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Liar.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Twas I what stole him. I’m the witch of the wood.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Liar! Liar!!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I am. THOMASIN smiles the smile of an older sister who know’s h fib is working. And she’s not going to stop.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: List not to her Mercy.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I am that very witch. When I sleep my spirit slips away from my body and dances naked with The Devil. That's how I signed his book.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: No! THOMASIN grows more serious in her play.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: He bade me bring him an unbaptized babe, and I stole Sam, and I gave him to my master. And I’1l make any man or thing else vanish I like.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Aye. And I‘’1l vanish thee too if thou displeaseth me.  37.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Be quiet.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Mercy, she’s but telling fantasies.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Or perchance I’1l boil and bake thee since we are lack of food.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Stop Thomasin. MERCY starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: It’s not true! THOMASIN seems very serious now.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: It is, thou thing! How I crave to sink my teeth into thy pink flesh.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: I’m not afraid of thee!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I’ll make thee afraid before I have done with thee! MERCY starts to run. THOMASIN runs after her and grabs he arm.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Let me go! Let me go! I am not afraid for God hath kept me and will keep me still!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: If ever thou tellst thy mother of this, I will witch thee and thy mother! And Jonas too!

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Caleb! MERCY cries and runs again. THOMASIN stops her, she pins MERCY down to the ground. THOMASIN SLAPS HER FACE!  38.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Stop thy tears and swear thy silence.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: I swear it.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: You will not tell Mother nor Father!

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: I swear!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Thomasin, let her alone! MERCY gets up.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Get away from her Caleb or she’ll witch thee! MERCY runs away. CALEB looks at THOMASIN.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Why tell Mercy those horrible fancies?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Dost thou hate me too?

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: It was a wolf stole Sam.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I know. She holds back her tears.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leave me be. Go tell Mother and Father of my wickedness. CALEB walks toward her.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dost hear me?

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Thomaisn, I-  39.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Leave.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I hate thy pity. I need it not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM'S eyes are closed. With open arms, his hands reac above his head and up to Heaven. His words are not rhetorical. They are in earnest.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: ...and forgive us the sins we have this day committed against thee... EVERYONE is at the table in prayer. Food is very scant.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Free us from the shame and torment which are due unto us for them. We beseech thee, increase our faith in the promises of the gospel, our fear of thy name, and the hatred of all our sins; that we may be assured that thy Holy Spirit dwells in us, that we might be thy children in thy love and mercy. For as we hunger for this food of our bodies, so our souls hunger for the food of eternal life. Finish soon our days of sin, and bring us to everlasting peace through the purifying blood of thy son, our Lord and only Saviour Christ Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Amen. WILLIAM puts his arms down. CALEB looks at his father. WILLIAM keeps his eyes to his food. THOMASIN looks at Mercy. MERCY looks away with fear.  40.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thomasin, where hast thou put the silver cup? CALEB looks up from his meal.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Is’t not on the shelf?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Nay.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: In the six board then.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: T’aint there neither. It has been disappeared for some while. (pause. ) Didst lose it?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I haven't touched it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Where has it gone then?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I haven't touched it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I have caught thee trifling with it before.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: She sayth she haven’t touched it Katherine.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: How thou couldst lose my father’s silver wine cup in this hovel, I cannot know.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I have no-

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Peace child, it is gone. Did a wolf vanish that too?  41. THOMASIN’S stomach sinks. CALEB looks at his father. WILLIAM keeps his gaze down on his own dinner. The tension is VERY palpable. Sounds of the crackling fire fill the silence.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: She haven’t touched it Katherine. WILLIAM takes another bite of food and wipes his beard. E on his plate. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What is amiss on this farm? KATHERINE looks down. KATHERINE (CONT’D) It is not natural. JONAS and MERCY look back at THOMASIN with accusatory eye

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Caleb? CALEB look at his father nervously... Will he make him confess?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Will you read out the chapter of The Word to-night? CALEB nods “yes,” relieved.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We must find some light in our darkness. To-morrow we will have a fast day but for our sins. Everyone is silent. From outside A GOAT BLEATS.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thomasin... Another bleat. Louder.  42. KATHERINE (CONT’D) Didst not bed them down before supper? Thomasin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another bleat, even wilder. The frightening sound echoes the night. THOMASIN walks alone with a lantern to THE GOAT SHED. Her cloak has been hastily thrown on. The darkness of the farmyard is heavy on her. She can faintly hear CALEB reading from The Bible. As she walks, something moves in the trees. She turns her head to the treetops and hears the “clicket clackety.” Pause. Her breath quickens. She walks closer, cautiously, slowly. A terrible screeching and grunting coming from the GOAT S She walks closer to the open door... she holds up her lam

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NANNY GOATS. THE NANNY GOAT screams as she tries to pull from him. He keeps her in the grasp of his strong legs an muddy hooves. BLACK PHILLIP keeps grunting and thrusting. THOMASIN gasps. She doesn’t look away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM is in bed staring wide eyed at the wall. The bed curtains are open and KATHERINE is kneeling on th floor praying by candlelight.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Love, put out the light. KATHERINE keeps praying.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You must sleep tonight. Kate?  43. KATHERINE finishes her parer and gets into bed. WILLIAM puts his arm around KATHERINE.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thou dost remember I love thee? She KISSES his large farmer’s HAND.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: List me Kate, I fear thou lookst too much upon this affliction. We must bend our thoughts towards God, not ourselves. (pause. ) He hath never taken a child from us. Never a one, Kate. Who might earn that grace? We have been ungrateful of God’s love. KATHERINE embraces her husband and buries her face in his chest. WILLIAM comforts her the best he can.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: He hath cursed this family.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: No. He hath taken us into a very low condition to humble us and to show us more of his grace. Still in his embrace, KATHERINE turns away.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Was not Christ was led into the wilderness to be ill met by the devil?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: We should ne’er have left the plantation.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Kate —

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: We should never have left. KATHERINE looks at him. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: That damnéd church!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) There is naught hither.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What need we? Silver Chalices? This stings KATHERINE.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: How dare you chide me on a cup? Tis not for vanity that I am grieved of it. WILLIAM looks to the wall again. His stomach sinks. He me to confess:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Katherine, I must tell thee-

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) We might have sold it.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What fool will trade for our corn?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: List me Kate, I-

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) No, listen to me, William:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Kate —

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: William! Our daughter hath begat the sign of her womanhood...  45. KATHERINE stops, she picks up her voice and calls above. KATHERINE (CONT’D) Thomasin? Caleb? Are y’abed? Mercy? Dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jonas? Still silent. KATHERINE closes the bed drapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB and THOMASIN are awake, sitting around a burning candle. JONAS and MERCY are tucked in to their bed, awake too. They all listen intently to every word of their parents’ whispers.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) She’s old enough, she needs must leave to serve another family. THOMASIN is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nay, I must have each our hands -

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And each our empty stomachs too? THOMASIN’S face sinks. CALEB want to look at her but he doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Twas not her fault. I must tell thee Kate-

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aye, it was thine for taking thy family hither.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is Godly land-  46.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Godly? Our children are being fostered up like savages.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Kate!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How oft I begged and begged thee to take Samuel for baptism.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There was never - I’d not - They’d not baptize outside the congregation -

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Our Sam is in hell!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Go to. KATHERINE calms herself.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: God save us, Caleb is well. WILLIAM hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: He is also near the age of... apprenticeship.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We must keep him still. And Thomasin.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That corn is trash.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We cannot back to that church!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We will starve!  47.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Peace. You'll wake ‘em. Peace. I’11l take the horse to village tomorrow with Thomasin. The Tildens or the Whytings, they can make use of her. They are good folk. Kate. Kate. Stop. We will find food. I know it. CALEB looks over at THOMASIN. She is crying into in her pillow. HOLD ON: CALEB. BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB, by candlelight, unties THE HORSE’S REINS from a po

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (0.8)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Caleb! Caleb! He turns and sees THOMASIN walking around the farmyard. S sees him! THOMASIN comes into the barn and quickly hides from the v of the farmhouse. CALEB drops the reins and scrambles away from THE HORSE.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing? He’s caught. He won’t look at her.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Go to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: What’s this? Tell me now!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: THOMASIN sees that BURT THE HORSE has his work-saddle and bridle on.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Running away then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Lie not to me.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Tell me! I’11 wake mother and father. CALEB ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As you like. THOMASIN starts to head toward the house. CALEB gets scared that she’s not bluffing:

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: If thou wilt back to sleep, and keep silent of this, I promise thee, you’ll need not leave to serve the Tildens nor any family else.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Caleb -

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Tis not pity for thee, so chide me not. I’1ll be back by mid-day. CALEB goes over to the horse.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Let me along with you.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: I cannot. THOMASIN gives him a look that she is not to be trifled w  49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wood is still dark. THOMASIN rides BURT. CALEB is on foot, holding the reins leading the way with his flickering lantern. FOWLER trots along beside them. CALEB has the musket. The match-cord is lit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB finds one of THE TRAPS by THE LARGE OVERTURNED TREE bends down.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Well? CALEB turns to her with a smile! They’ve made a catch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB and THOMASIN move now with a swifter, more assured pace. A muskrat and other small game hang from the horse’s tack Their spirits are light:

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Aye but we did!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Nay.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: We did.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: We had glass windows in England. We have not been hither so long that you can forget that?

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: As you like, Thomasin.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: You’ve gone mad!  50.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: We did.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Dost not remember Fowler laying on the floor i’the sun? You must! And the curious-curled shadows upon his back...?

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Nay.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: You do! And where the sun would shine, would he warm himself. (to Fowler) Wouldn’t you, thou idler? Remember once he lay upon the table, and Father saw him and he saith “we will have him for meat! Kate, Kate! We will roast this beast”(she laughs). You must remember that!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: I remember that day, but no glass. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Well... THOMASIN is very frustrated that Caleb cannot remember... finds herself surprisingly emotional about this window.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...it was pretty. Suddenly, FOWLER starts tracking something.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: What is’t boy?

dialogues.speaker: FOWLER POINTS
dialogues.text: CALEB and THOMASIN look ahead.  51. Standing about fifty yards before them is same giant HARE from yesterday! BURT IS SPOOKED. He neighs and clomps around, kicking up and tossing his head up oddly. THOMASIN holds tight to th work saddle. CALEB tries to keep his footing.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Burt, calm thee. THOMASIN pats BURT to calm him and CALEB gives her the re THE HARE stays motionless, looking straight at CALEB. CALEB carefully prepares the musket. He takes aim... He shouts:

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fowler, thence! FOWLER RUNS toward THE HARE, barking loudly! BURT neighs again, going rampant, nearly knocking THOMASI off.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Burt!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Fowler Nay! Fowler!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stand here with Burt!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Caleb, he’s gone mad!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I'll straight back! BUT IT IS TOO LATE...  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB travels deeper into The Wood, running. THE TREES have become more indiscernible from one another Tall seemingly identical trunks stand looming in every direction. He stops, panting. He turns around.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Thomasin? Thomasin! He hears nothing. He tries to whistle for Fowler like his father does. It c out airy and quiet.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Folwer! He attempts to whistle again. It doesn't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONAS AND MERCY are tethered to a long rope tied to the f so they cannot wander from the farm. THE GOAT-BELLS from nanny goats have also been tied to them.

dialogues.speaker: TWINS
dialogues.text: Caleb! Caleb! THE BELLS CLANK as they walk. KATHERINE and WILLIAM are in the distant fields near THE searching, calling their children's names. A light rain starts to fall. It plinks on the GOAT-BELLS.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (in the distance) Caleb, lad! Thomasin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN wakes.  53.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Caleb? SHE stand, uneasy. She looks around. SHE knows where she is. She is near OVERTURNED TREE where Caleb set the first trap. How did she get there? She turns back.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Caleb! Burt?! Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Caleb!! She runs on toward home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB holds his musket ready. THE TREES and underbrush ha become even more dense and tangled. He prays aloud as he walks:

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: O God my Lord, I now begin, O help me and I'll leave my sin. For I repentant now will be, From evil I will turn to thee. None ever shall destroy my faith, Nor do I mind what Satan saith. O God my Lord, I now begin, O help me and I'll leave my sin - He hears the yelp of the dog. It echoes in the wood. He runs fast after the noise. He cannot see through the m He keeps running. Running. He trips and falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN clumsily weaves through crackling branches. Daylight is waning. She breaths heavily, trying to run, but she is exhausted. All of a sudden, she hears something faint... voices! They are almost inaudible:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Caleb! Thomasin!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Caleb! She picks up her pace!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB trudges through a strange winding path of dense, twisting, vines and thorns. He tries to run, but the rain, fog, and spiky terrain slo him down. His stockings get caught on some thorns. He recoils in pain and drops THE MUSKET. He tries to disentangle himself, further cutting his fing and legs. He tries to pick up the musket but it is caught in THE THORNS. He pulls and pulls and it only makes things worse His hands bleed more. He is crying. IN THE DISTANCE IS A SWEET MELODY. A WOMAN HUMMING. He turns his head to find where the music is coming from. A few yards in front of him is THE HARE! THE HARE JUMPS AWAY. CALEB FOLLOWS, LEAVING THE MUSKET IN THE RAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN comes to the edge of the tree line and sees her  55. father in the last light of dusk.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Father! Father! He hears her and runs toward her!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thomasin! They meet, WILLIAM picks her up in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thomasin! My girl. He hugs her tight in the rain. He rubs his cheek on hers. WILLIAM looks into her glassy eyes:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where is thy brother? EXT. WITCH’S HOVEL - DUSK CALEB emerges from the barbed path to see a faint warm li The humming is more distinct. Through the mist and rain THE WITCH’S HOVEL becomes visib The pointed structure sits up high on four knotted tree trunks. Matted branches overhang its sagging moss-grown thatch-roof, upon which there is no chimney, just a hole puffing smoke. The whole thing looks held together by ill omened weeds, plants, and sinister roots that grow all ov and through the muddy walls like a plague. A rotting foot-ladder leads up to the slightly open front door. Firelight glows from within. CALEB continues to walk toward the humming. THE HARE is nowhere to be seen. He stumbles through a large FIRE PIT with BONES strewn ab the ground. Rain plinks on a huge IRON CAULDRON in the ce of the pit. Just then, THE DOOR opens wider... CALEB stops short. Out steps a BEAUTIFUL WOMAN (20s) IN A RED CLOAK. She smo a small CLAY PIPE.  56. CALEB steps back. He is soaking wet. He tries his best to stop crying, to no avail. THE WOMAN comes forward and her very dirty, but dainty, b foot takes one step down the foot ladder. She leans forward. She reaches her arms out sympathetical toward CALEB. Her face is greasy, but stunning. Her filthy bodice is cu quite low. There are a few small moles on her ample breas CALEB sees this all. He stays still. The rain falls. THE WOMAN beckons him. CALEB walks toward her, he is drawn to her. He can’t help it. She crouches on the foot ladder. CALEB is now face to face with her. She smiles at CALEB. Some of her teeth are crooked and browned near the gums, is startling, but she is beautiful all the same. She strokes CALEB’S head and embraces him. Tears still fall from CALEB’S eyes. He trembles. He looks at THE WOMAN’S face, he looks into her hypnotic AMBER EYES. She smiles so sweetly. She draws CALEB NEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: THOMASIN standing against the wall, shaking. Guilty. Soaking wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with thee Thomasin? What’s the matter with thee? THOMASIN cannot move.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I'll leave at first light and I'1l1 return not till I find him.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Twould be better to go to the village and raise up help. I cannot bear -

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Tis a days ride and I have not a horse. There is not time to be lost.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Likely you should have left this morn then.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You have no gun, William, nay, not even a dog. Be not a fool. 57. THOMASIN watches WILLIAM get up and put on his wet cloak hat.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I am a fool to go. There is none will help our family. WILLIAM rummages through the house.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s the lanthorn? He rummages some more. He can’t find it. In frustration, WILLIAM shouts: he throws something acros the room with a bang. THOMASIN covers her eyes. JONAS AND MERCY cower in the corner.  58.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be it so. The moon is bright. Rain bothers me not. I’1l be back in a two day -- If any a man will return with me.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Don’t go Father!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Please you Father, don’t go!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Enough. (to Thomasin, calmly.) Tell us why you went into The Wood.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I promised. THOMASIN exchanges a quick glance with her father.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I care not.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Let me find favor in your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Child, tell me and thou wilt.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Speak! WILLIAM steps out from the shadows of the room.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I took thy father’s cup. (pause. ) I sold it. Forgive me Kate. Forgive me Thomasin.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kate, I must make a confession... (pause. ) I, yestermorn, I took Caleb to The Wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN pelts down upon the tiny house. KATHERINE bursts out of the door into the rain. WILLIAM runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Twas for food - and the pelts for money. Good money.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I knew you were false! I knew it!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I did want it a surprise, twas why I kept silent. I will trap that wolf. Stop! Stop Kate! WILLIAM grabs hold of her arm.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You stood by whilst our son lied to me!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: ‘Twas for thy sake. I love thee Kate.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You took him to the Wood!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I will find him.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You have broken God’s covenant. You are a liar. And you have lost another child. 59.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I will go now!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You cannot escape the wood!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I will find him!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: And kill thyself too? Will Jonas be the man of the house? Will you damn all your family to death?!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Kate-

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Let go of me. THEY struggle.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I will find my son! KATHERINE slaps WILLIAM very hard in the face. WILLIAM lifts his hand to strike his wife.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Father! THE CHILDREN are gathered by the open door. They watch th parents fight in the rain. WILLIAM sees his children. He puts his hand down, he picks up KATHERINE in his arms, walks toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN tends to her father’s bloody nose by THE HEARTH. WILLIAM shivers in his wet clothes. He looks at his daugh ashamed. KATHERINE sits on the other side of the fire holding JONA AND MERCY in her arms. She rocks them back in forth.  61.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Picking apples. Silence. THOMASIN looks at KATHERINE.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Mother, have the goats been bedded down?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Nay.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I will to it.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Let it wait till the morrow. They dare not scape with this rain.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Nay, I will to it. Please you, Mother.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Come hither child. THOMASIN walks to her mother... KATHERINE embraces THOMASIN along with her other remainin children. Pause. KATHERINE looks at THOMASIN’S yearning face. She kisses h warmly. KATHERINE (CONT’D) Hurry back.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. GOAT SHED
dialogues.text: THOMASIN proudly pets THE NANNY GOATS and sooths them. BL PHILLIP stands by, his horns casting enormous shadows fro THOMASIN’S LANTERN LIGHT. THOMASIN brings one of THE WHITE NANNIES down to the grou No sound but the pitter-patter of the rain outside. Long Pause.  62. SUDDENLY, THOMASIN hears the sound of FOOTSTEPS outside i the grass... More footsteps. Stumbling around. SHE HEARS THE SOUND of a wooden creak. THOMASIN is still. She hears the wood creak again more forcefully. THOMASIN flees from the GOAT SHED to see what it is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IT’S CALEB! WET. NAKED. PALE AS DEATH. He grasps a FENCE-POST trying to stay standing in the pou rain. THOMASIN runs to him. SHE embraces him. He is shivering.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Caleb. Caleb! CALEB collapses in THOMASIN’S arms. THOMASIN shrieks:

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Father! Mother! THOMASIN brings her lamp to CALEB’S face:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutters are closed. Several tapers are lit. CALEB is in his straw bed breathing stertorously. His eye are closed. There are several small scabs around his mout His lips move slightly, occasionally muttering something inaudible. THOMASIN wipes the perspiration from his brow. KATHERINE takes a broad strip of linen and sprinkles it w herbs. Then she holds a taper into the flame of a wood-  63. candle. The flame billows a thick smoke as KATHERINE drip the hot tallow over the herbs. She places this poulticed cloth over CALEB’S bare stomach and ties it taught with THOMASIN’S help. JONAS & MERCY sit by his pillow and touch him gently with their tiny fingers. THE TWINS LOOK AT THOMASIN WITH SUSPICION. THOMASIN tries ignore this. KATHERINE gives THOMASIN a small bowl to hold by CALEB’S head. KATHERINE takes her knife and makes a small cut ina protruding vein in CALEB’S temple. BLOOD drips into the b KATHERINE begins to pray. THOMASIN looks at her father. WILLIAM stands reticently from a couple paces back, leani his hand on one of the beams of the garret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM IN THE POURING RAIN, chops wood. CHOP.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. GOAT SHED
dialogues.text: THOMASIN is in the shed with A PAIL and milking stool, readying one of THE NANNY GOATS for milking. SHE looks over at THE TWINS: They sit in the fodder with BLACK PHILLIP. MERCY looks at his legs, his hoofs. She plays with the lo matted, dung-covered hair on his legs. She still has THE BELL tied to her coat. She plays the part:

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Baa. Baa. JONAS, also still wearing a bell, lifts up BLACK PHILLIP’ ear and whispers into it.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: (whispering) Baa. Baa.  64.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: (whispering) Baaa. Baaa. Baaa.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (whispers ) What ails Caleb, Black Phillip? What ails him? Did Thomasin make ‘im sick in The Wood?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: What say you?

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: Mind thy self. I know what you did to Sam.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Go to.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: Black Phillip saith you are wicked.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Aye, he told me too.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Damn your Black Phillip!

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: He saith you put The Devil in Caleb, that’s why he’s sick.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I'd never hurt Caleb, nor Sam, nor thee.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: You beat me!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: It was a jest.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: You said you’d eat of me!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Mercy!?

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Mother and Father will find out.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: What?  65.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: That you are a witch! THOMASIN calms down. She ignores them.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thomasin... do you hear? THOMASIN continues to ignore him and gets to work. She grabs one of THE GOAT’S teats.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thomasin... She squeezes. BLOOD SQUIRTS INTO THE PAIL. THOMASIN is in disbelief. SHE squeezes again. MORE BLOOD. THOMASIN gasps and jumps to her feet ACCIDENTALLY KICKING PAIL OF BLOOD TO THE GROUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB lies in his trance-like state, his white face faint lit by the small garret window. KATHERINE is next to him praying. WILLIAM creaks sheepishly up the ladder.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (to herself) Amen. KATHERINE (CONT’D) Dost remember John Kempe’s boy? That first winter, he was tormented of Indian magic. WILLIAM sighs.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Tis not the same.  66.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) This is unnatural providence.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I know not that.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Look at thy son.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Will...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Think.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Think what?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Think.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I have no thought KATHERINE puts her face down on CALEB’S chest.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Does this look not like witchcraft!? (Pause).

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What witch? Who is it that does this then? Who? Thy thoughts are as a child.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: WILLIAM opens a chest and starts taking things off the be of the garret and putting them inside. KATHERINE (CONT’D) What are you doing?  67.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: We'll back to the plantation in the morn. Find a good family for Thomasin. Take Caleb to the Doctor. He will find whether this be some natural ill or no.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yet we cannot return beggars. We will scour the field. There may be some fruit yet untouched by this rot. KATHERINE looks to CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I beseech thee Katherine, what canst thou do for him presently?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: How might we all bare it to the village with no horse?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: The little corn with the goats, can fetch a fair price. We’ll back with Caleb, sell em, then return with a horse for the twins and Thomasin.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) You cannot leave them here-

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping) No, nay. Thomasin and thee -

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Forget the crop Will!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping) What? What? What dost thou want!? Tell me and I’1l give it thee! KATHERINE touches CALEB’S sweaty hair.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I want to be home.  68.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thou wilt be home by candle-time tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: In England.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Will, I... I also have a confession to make: WILLIAM is still. KATHERINE (CONT’D) I never wished to be a shrew to thee. I have become as Job’s wife, I know it, but since Sam, since... My heart has turned to stone. (KATHERINE swells, but keeps her emotions in check) ) I had dreamed once - twas when I was of Thomasin’s years - that I was with Christ upon earth. I was so very near him and in many tears for the assurance of the pardon of my sins and was so ravished with his love towards me, I thought it far exceeding the affection of the kindest husband. The impression of it was so deep in my heart, when I waked, my pillow had turned to tears.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: And, since Samuel disappeared, I have such a sad weakness of faith that I cannot shake it. I cannot see Christ’s help as near. I pray and pray but I cannot . . . I fear I cannot ever feel that same measure of love again.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (curt) Thou shalt have of it in heaven. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Pause. ) I'll be i’the field. If you can spare a while, do. WILLIAM slams the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll leave at dawn. I promise thee that.

dialogues.speaker: EXT/INT. GOAT SHED
dialogues.text: THOMASIN tries to cover THE BLOOD with dung. JONAS AND MERCY watch her. WILLIAM shouts:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thomasin! Jonas, Mercy! Come hither! THOMASIN turns to THE TWINS.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Speak not a word!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM AND JONAS are routing through the cornfield destroying the bundled corn shocks. WILLIAM carries a lar mostly empty basket on his shoulder. JONAS crawls around the dirt, throwing useless finds to the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATHERINE AND THOMASIN are taking the salvageable ears an hanging them to dry on side of the house. KATHERINE uses BILLHOOK (a rustic knife like a small machete) to cut the fungus out of the kernels. THOMASIN is very glad to be working with her mother. MERCY is behind her singing:

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (sings) Black Phillip is a merry merry king He rules the land with mirth.  70.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I cannot abide your songs.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Please you, Mercy. MERCY stares at her sister:

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (sings) Black Philip has a mighty mighty sting He’1l knock thee to the earth. Sing bah bah King Phillip the black sing bah bah bah bah bah

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Peace thou thing.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Mercy. Thomasin.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (sings) Sing bah bah King Phillip the black He’1ll knock thee on thy back!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Enough! JUST THEN, a terrible SHRIEK is heard from the house! EVERYONE STOPS AND TURNS.

dialogues.speaker: LUNGS
dialogues.text: WILLIAM throws his basket to the ground, KATHERINE drops BILLHOOK on the bench outside the front door and they run inside. JONAS and MERCY look at THOMASIN and then run toward the house too.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Get the broad axe and cut off her head. His eyes are open wide. His head is back. He sweats profusely. KATHERINE AND WILLIAM try to hold him down.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get the narrow axe and cut off her head! THOMASIN and THE TWINS watch dumbfounded. CALEB is writhing in pain, contorting his body with each these horrible descriptions:

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s upon me, she kneels.. my belly... my bowels, she pinches... scratches. She... ch-- CALEB’S face grows red as if he is being CHOKED.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Caleb!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Sin! SIN! SIN!!!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Thomasin, take the children outside. KATHERINE holds CALEB and he squirms in her arms.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Father, what’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Sin!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Caleb!  72.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Mother! Father!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Thomasin! Take them hence! THOMASIN grabs at JONAS AND MERCY’S hands but they run fr her, watching their brother.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: (overlapping) God is naught. God is naught. CALEB breathes heavily. His eyes roll back in his head.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Who does this to thee? Who does this? CALEB keeps breathing heavily, his mouth shuts tight. His teeth are clenched. KATHERINE tries to open his mouth. KATHERINE (CONT’D) His mouth is sealed-up. CALEB’S mouth foams, a bit of BLOOD comes out. He is seiz violently.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Children, keep from this. Thomasin help!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: No! THOMASIN rushes to the bed. She holds CALEB down while WILLIAM tries to open CALEB’S mouth with his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: He'll break his jaws. CALEB tightens his bite. WILLIAM panics. HE TAKES THE KNIFE FROM HIS BELT AND TRIE FORCE CALEB’S MOUTH OPEN WITH THE WOODEN HANDLE. CALEB is groaning, BLOOD spills from his mouth and WILLIA holds THE KNIFE HANDLE, trying not to cut CALEB or himsel CALEB keeps breathing hard.  73. KATHERINE (CONT’D) What is’t? What is’t? THERE IS SOMETHING BEHIND CALEB’S TEETH... PUSHING THROUG WILLIAM pulls the knife away. CALEB STARTS RETCHING... HE HEAVES, AND HEAVES...

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN SHUDDERS.
dialogues.text: WILLIAM AND KATHERINE pull away in terror. CALEB subsides. THE FAMILY WATCHES THE APPLE FALL TO THE FLOOR. KATHERINE looks at WILLIAM. KATHERINE (CONT’D) William?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: He is witched!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: No! Pause. JONAS points at THOMASIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘Tis she!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Nol!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM AND KATHERINE TURN TO JONAS.
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What horrible fancy’s this?

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: She told me she stole Sam!  74.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Silence. Go back to the yard!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: (overlapping) She gave him to The Devil in The Wood.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: They lie!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) What say you?

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: She meets The Devil in The Wood!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: She turned Flora’s milk to blood.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: She had bade us keep secret from you.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: It was but a jest to quiet her. I.. THE TWINS run to their parents.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: She made bargain with Satan!

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: She signed his book!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Silence. THOMASIN goes toward them.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Don’t let her near me. She'll place a curse on me.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Father!

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Mother!  75.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) They conspire against me.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Thomasin is a witch! WILLIAM stands.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Nay. I’1l not hear it.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: She is! WILLIAM pushes the children away from him.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I'll have proof of it, or heaven help thee. On thy knees!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Stop it William! The children kneel.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Look me in the eye daughter. Dost thou love the word of God?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Love you The Bible? Love you Prayer?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: We are children of sin all, yet I tell thee, I have raised up no witch in this house. Let us pray, then we need fear nothing. We shall never lie open to the wicked one. Pray for thy brother.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: You must believe us.  76.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Evil, wretches! THOMASIN starts after the twins!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thomasin!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Pray! THE TWINS stand there frozen.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pray! Our Father, which art in heaven... THE TWINS stay still. They stare at CALEB’S bloody mouth bedclothes.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Jonas, pray!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: I... I cannot remember my prayer.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Nor I.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: I cannot.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Stop this nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Speak children, Our Father, which art in heaven, hallowed... THE TWINS look as if they are in pain. MERCY’S eyes fill with tears.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Pray. Pray you beasts.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Thomasin! Stop!  77.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Come now? PRAY!!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: I cannot.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I cannot. THOMASIN pushes MERCY to the floor!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Get on thy knees and pray! MERCY shrieks in pain!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Damnation!

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Thomasin, stop!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I cannot hear this. This is not so!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) On my life and soul!

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Let us pray sister, I crave of thee!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thomasin.... if they speak true...

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Let us pray Thomasin!! SUDDENLY: CALEB STARTS TO SCREAM. JONAS AND MERCY START TO SCREAM THE SAME WAY AS CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: A toad. A cat. A crow. A raven. A great black dog. A wolf.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Stop this. Stop  78. JONAS and MERCY start acting like animals bleating and ca in a horrifying manner, they do not seem like children.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: (overlapping) She desires of my blood. She sends ‘em upon me. They feed upon her teats, her nether parts. She sends ‘em upon me. JONAS and MERCY scream in pain doing all the same actions CALEB.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: They desire of my blood. They bite me, they bite me!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: (overlapping) My Lord, My Jesus! Save me! She sends her Devils...

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Thomasin!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Stop it stop it!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Think on Christ!

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: I am thine enemy, wallowing in the blood and filth of my sins.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: The Lord is my shepherd...

dialogues.speaker: CALEB WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I am thine enemy, wallowing The Lord is my shepherd, in the blood and filth of my sins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am thine enemy wallowing in the blood and filth of my sins.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I am thine enemy wallowing in the blood and filth of my sin 79.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I shall not want. He maketh me to rest in green pasture, & leadeth me by the still waters. He restoreth my soul, & leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his Names sake. Yea, though I should walk through the valley of the shadow of death, fear no evil: I will

dialogues.speaker: CALEB/WILLIAM/KATHERINE
dialogues.text: For thou art with me.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Caleb! CALEB shouts:

dialogues.speaker: CALEB
dialogues.text: Cast the light of thy Countenance upon me. Spread over me the lap of thy love. JONAS and MERCY silently mouth the words he says and they tremor on the floor near him. CALEB (CONT’D) Wash me in the ever-flowing fountains of thy blood. Let me ever be with thee. Wholly thine I am, my sweet Lord Jesus. As CALEB'’S words grow more intense, he continues to writ and his motions and exclamations seem DISTURBINGLY EROTIC

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: O my Lord, my love! Kiss me with the kisses of thy mouth, how lovely art thou! ...thy embrace! MY LORD, MY LOVE, MY SOUL’S

dialogues.speaker: SALVATION, TAKE ME TO THY LAP
dialogues.text: CALEB collapses completely limp.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: I love thee Jesus, I love thee.  80.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: I am thine, Lord. JONAS and MERCY collapse too, their chests moving heavily and_down. Pause. Everyone else is still, trying to process what they have seen. THOMASIN looks at her brother:

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Caleb! She runs to his body and embraces it. KATHERINE grabs him too.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Caleb. KATHERINE tries to rouse CALEB. THOMASIN turns to the twi

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Jonas, Mercy. Get up. Get up!!! THOMASIN yanks them up. They fall to the ground, silent, breathing. THOMASIN looks back at her brother. He is not moving. Not breathing. KATHERINE turns to WILLIAM:

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: He is dead.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: He is dead! THOMASIN panics!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN runs across the fields! WILLIAM runs after her.  81.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thomasin! Thomasin! THOMASIN collapses in the grass by AN OLD ENORMOUS OAK TR She sobs. WILLIAM holds her in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My girl. They sit for a moment under the tree, catching their brea She buries her head in his chest. He takes her hand. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This tree will be lovely come spring. Remember when we came hither?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: A fine tree. Next year I'd have sewn a wheat field. Started at this tree and ended thither. We’d have been a proper farm then. I’d have bought us a great fat milk cow, finished us the barn...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You must tell me, Thomasin... (pause. ) Tomorrow, I cannot keep secret of this, a council will be called and thy life is... thy life...

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: You will not believe me?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I saw The Serpent in my son. You stopped their prayer Thomasin-  82. THOMASIN pushes away.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) They lie.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I saw it. I have been blind Thomasin. Caleb disappeared with thee!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I love Caleb!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping) ) And who then found him, naked as sin, pale as death and witched!? (he calms) List me Thomasin, the bargain thou hast made is of no effect.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I made no bargain.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thy soul belongeth to Christ....

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I made no bargain.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: ...The Devil hath no interest in thee! THOMASIN stand in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I am no witch, father!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: What did I but see in my house?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Will you not hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I prithee, confess-  Pause. 83.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Why have you turned against me?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Jesus Christ can unwitch us if you will but speak the truth to me. As I love thee, speak truth!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: You ask me to speak truth?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I beg thee! Thomasin turns cold.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: You and Mother are planned to rid the farm of me.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Aye. I heard you speak of it. Is that truth?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: You took of Mother’s cup and let her rail at me. Is that truth?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Peace thee.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I will not.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: I am thy father!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: You are a hypocrite!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Hold thy tongue Daughter mine!  84.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: You took Caleb to The Wood and let me take the blame of that too. You confessed not till it was too late. Is that truth? You let Mother be as thy master! You cannot bring the crops to yield! You cannot hunt! Is that truth enough?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Thou canst do nothing save cut wood!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Bitch! WILLIAM grabs THOMASIN and holds her close to his face. SHE looks imploringly into his eyes:

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: And you will not hear me!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Must I hear The Devil wag his tongue in thy mouth? THOMASIN’S eyes ignite.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Ask the twins then.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Ask them. They spend all day long babbling to that horned beast. They know well his voice.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Go to!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: The Adversary oft comes in the shape of a he-goat. And whispers. Aye, whispers. (Pause. ) He is Lucifer, you know it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The twins know it.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Slander thy brethren no more.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: It is they!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: From my sight.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I‘1l not move from this spot till you put the question to them.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Get up.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Twas they and that goat what bewitched this whole farm.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Lies!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Was’t a wolf stole Sam? I never saw no wolf. Mercy told me herself by the stream “I be the witch of the wood!”

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Get up. Rise!! WILLIAM grabs THOMASIN by the shoulder violently and drag her across the fields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CALEB’S BODY lies on the table. KATHERINE is preparing hi for burial. WILLIAM bursts through the door and throws THOMASIN to th

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Speak!  86.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I am no witch.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Get her from my sight! I’11 not have her in this house.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: She is no witch, Katherine. What is the cause, daughter? Tell thy mother. THOMASIN looks at JONAS AND MERCY in their parent’s bed, closed, moaning, trance-like.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I cannot know for certain.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thou toldst me well thou knew!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: I cannot look at her.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Aye, but y’shall: Thomasin?

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Thomasin!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Jonas and Mercy... they made covenant with The Devil in the shape of Black Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Dost hear that? Ye Black minions? Dost hear, yolk Devils? WILLIAM shakes THE TWINS in their sleeping trance:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wake. Wake from this. Did ye make some unholy bond with that goat? Speak if this is pretense! THE TWINS lie still.  WILLIAM laughs angrily and frighteningly.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dissemblers! Grave pretenders all. Hear me this: I will not play a fool to children’s games!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: This is no sport William.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Yet these lies from our babes’ mouths are but trifles to them.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I do not lie!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Silence, creature!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Thy son is dead. Damned.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Caleb did but cry Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: The Devil!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You know it not!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: The Devil will speak Scripture too.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: You know it not. It is not true!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: We are Damned! WILLIAM explodes:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Wake!! He shakes THE TWINS violently.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fetch the billhook Wife and I will smite thee Jonas as Abraham would have done his seed! 87.  88.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: William stop this! WILLIAM picks up Joseph by the scruff of the neck.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Fetch the billhook and I’1l dash his skull! JONAS wakes up immediately and screams! MERCY jumps from the bed, alert, awake.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Do you see?! Do you so see now?!

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Damnation!!!

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. GOAT SHED
dialogues.text: Hammer! Hammer! Hammer! WILLIAM hammers old planks over the door of the GOAT SHED holds several nails in his teeth. His eyes wet with tears must do it. He has no choice. THE TWINS are screaming.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: No! It is not safe. Not with them! ALL THREE CHILDREN ARE INSIDE THE SHED WITH THE GOATS.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Keep me from this goat.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: If that old billy be The Devil, I would have danced with him myself. WILLIAM hammers in the last nail.  89.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ill break thee out upon the dawn, and we'll set back to the plantation. His children’s eyes look at him through the cracks. Their small pleading fingers stretch towards him.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Think on thy sins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN sits at one end of the shed. JONAS AND MERCY sit the other with BLACK PHILLIP and the other goats. JONAS strokes BLACK PHILLIP. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Are you witches? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: Does Father think I am one?

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
