dialogues.text: No. (Pause. ) Doth he really speak to thee? BLACK PHILLIP moves around in the shadows. THOMASIN looks at him, guarded at first, but slowly becom more intoxicated with curiosity. THE GOAT stares back with his otherworldly rectangular pupils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wind blows. WILLIAM AND KATHERINE stand beneath THE GIANT OLD OAK.  90. A SMALL, SHALLOW GRAVE has been dug. CALEB’S BODY, wrappe an old linen sheet, lies inside. WILLIAM and KATHERINE look on. They will not cry. KATHERINE tosses a few brittle sprigs of rosemary upon on chest. Pause. WILLIAM takes up a shovel. He starts to cover the body wi earth. KATHERINE stays still. Pause. She steps away... SHE CLIMBS DOWN INTO THE GRAVE. WILLIAM stops shoveling. KATHERINE HOLDS CALEB’S BODY TIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM looks on: She is not crying. Not hysterical. Just still. A living corpse. KATHERINE looks at WILLIAM hard in the eyes. Pause. THE SUN sets behind them, disappearing into THE WOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM chops wood. WILLIAM'S WOOD PILE is towering nearly as high as the hou Many of the logs have been haphazardly tossed up top and precariously over the edge. WILLIAM keeps cutting and tossing. He groans and grunts w every angry chop.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. GOAT SHED
dialogues.text: gl. THOMASIN and THE TWINS watch their father through the cra of the shed.

dialogues.speaker: -INTERCUT BETWEEN WILLIAM AND CHILDREN THE SHED-
dialogues.text: WILLIAM throws the axe to the ground. He whispers to God:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: It is my fault. He falls hard to his knees. His muscles shake with fatigu

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I confess it. I confess it!! He scoops up a hand full of earth and holds it tight in h fist. He looks to heaven:

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: O my God, I am false. I am bemired with the filth of pride. I am. I know it. Dispose of me as thou wilt, yet redeem my children. They cannot tame their natural evils. CLOSE ON: THOMASIN, listening. She takes in her father’s heavy words.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I lie before thee a coward and thine enemy and lick the dust of thy earth. WILLIAM brings the fist of dirt to his mouth... and swall it. He takes another handful...

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I beg thee wash them clean in thy blood. I beg thee my Christ... save my children. Save them. I beg thee... CLOSE ON: THOMASIN, listening. WILLIAM (0.S.) (CONT’D) I beg thee... I have not damned my family. I beg the...  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FARM waits quietly in the moonlight. No one is outside. No candle light creeps through the cracks in the door. The wind blows. Brittle branches rattle and snap. The tall trees creek and moan. Far away is the faintest sound of: “clickety-clackety- clickety-clackety-clickety-clackety-clickety-clackety.” It echoes through the forest and the farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JONAS AND MERCY lie awake in the hay and straw with the sleeping goats. THOMASIN is asleep on the other side of the shed. “Clickety-clackety, clickety-clakety”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATHERINE lies on her pillow half asleep. SHE FAINTLY HEA GIGGLING BABY. She opens her eyes. It is utterly black. She gets out of bed, fumbling to light a taper. She puts to a dying ember and the taper illuminates her face. In front of her is THE SILVER CUP! How can this be? She leans toward it... THE BABY GIGGLES again. SHE GASPS AND TURNS behind her: CALEB sits on a stool holding SAMUEL on his lap. They are clean and healthy, and illuminated by a dim ethereal ligh  93. SAMUEL wears a christening gown. KATHERINE gets up and goes to them.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: My lambs. My angels! Her face glows with joy! Her happy tears wash the grief f her face. She is beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Mother. We have longed to see you so. THEY EMBRACE. KATHERINE goes to her knees and looks up at CALEB. She ta SAM from his arms. SHE laughs!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: As I to thee! Her eyes light up. KATHERINE (CONT’D) I must wake thy father! He will be so glad-

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) ) No, let him sleep. CALEB strokes her hair.

dialogues.speaker: INT/EXT. GOAT HOUSE
dialogues.text: JONAS and MERCY clutch each other. The wind blows. The clickety-clackety through the trees has grown louder. Closer. Pause. The clickety-clackety comes again, this time they can hea the branches breaking off and falling upon the roof of th goat shed and on to the ground right next to them. Then they hear a light THUMP on the grass.  94. Now footsteps in the grass. They see SHADOWS moving through the wooden slats of the g shed. They hear a SCRATCHING on the wall of the shed. Someone is trying to open the door. A figure scuttles around the shed. They hear the sound of something burrowing or digging.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) We would see you oft mother. Would that please you?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: CALEB, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispering) I have brought a book for you, Mother. Will you look at it with me?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: Aye. KATHERINE (CONT’D) One moment yet, Samuel is hungry. Come come, my little Sam. KATHERINE PUTS SAM TO FEED AT HER BREAST. She smiles and closes her eyes. She holds up the back of his head. She feels at home again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MERCY and JONAS see something in the shed crawling around with them. They are squeezing each other’s arms in fear. Jonas lets out a whimper:

dialogues.speaker: JONAS
dialogues.text: Flora? Flora? Pause.  95. There is something near the nanny goats.

dialogues.speaker: JONAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Girl? THEY MOVE EVER SO SLIGHTLY CLOSER. THEY GO CLOSER.

dialogues.speaker: MERCY
dialogues.text: Flora? MERCY leans forward...

dialogues.speaker: IT IS THE HUNCHBACK OF THE OLD WITCH
dialogues.text: GOAT’S TEAT!

dialogues.speaker: JONAS AND MERCY SCREAM
dialogues.text: THE WITCH TURNS AROUND! HER BLOODY JAWS flash for a momen the scraps of moonlight within the shed. SHE REACHES HER BLOODY TALONS TOWARD THEM. THE CHILDREN KEEP SCREAMING, backing away! THOMASIN WAKES UP AND SHRIEKS. THE SOUND OF JONAS AND MERCY’S GOAT-BELLS CLANK AND CLATT OVER THEIR SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK.
dialogues.text: OVER BLACK: A wooden bang. Bang! Bang!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM'S eyes open wearily. The banging is coming from the side of the house. With each bang the house shakes and wood cracks. Bits of crumble off the walls. WILLIAM hears BLACK PHILLIP bleating loudly. He leaves the bed and throws on his breeches and boots. KATHERINE sits up and follows him with her eyes, not leav her bed. BLOOD SOAKS HER SHIFT AROUND HER NIPPLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WILLIAM leaves the house and goes into the misty farmyard

dialogues.speaker: BLACK PHILLIP IS BUCKING THE SIDE OF THE FARMHOUSE WITH H
dialogues.text: HORNS. Clapboards splinter off. He bleats and grunts, kic up dirt. WILLIAM yells and shoos him away.

dialogues.speaker: WILLIAM
dialogues.text: Back. Back! BLACK PHILLIP starts running madly around the farmyard. WILLIAM looks ahead. The thatch on THE GOAT SHED is all torn up; THERE IS A GI HOLE IN THE ROOF. The door William boarded-up has been smashed open. Fodder dung are spread out all over the ground of the farmyard. He walks closer. THE TWO NANNY GOATS LAY DEAD, their udders bleeding. JONAS AND MERCY ARE GONE. THOMASIN LIES AWAKE, shuddering in the fetal position, splashed in BLOOD. BLACK PHILLIP stands there. He bleats again, steam comes his mouth and nostrils. WILLIAM goes directly to THE CHOPPING BLOCK and grabs the AXE.  97. He marches over to BLACK PHILLIP. THE GOAT runs round him. WILLIAM runs after it, he raises the AXE high... WILLIAM takes a swipe and misses THE GOAT. THE GOAT bucks WILLIAM and knocks him to the ground, taki the wind out of him, then runs across his legs. WILLIAM heaves and then gets up. THE GOAT gallops toward THE WOOD PILE. WILLIAM runs after him, limping. He hacks at BLACK PHILLI slicing his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FIREWOOD.
dialogues.text: BLACK PHILLIP’S HORNS RUN THROUGH WILLIAM’S STOMACH, ONE OUT HIS BACK.

dialogues.speaker: TUMBLE DOWN ON WILLIAM.
dialogues.text: BLACK PHILLIP runs off. WILLIAM struggles under the huge pile of wood. BLOOD pour from his mouth, his abdomen and his head. He moves no more. THOMASIN walks ghost-like toward her dead father. She kneels down next to him. She reaches her hand out to touch his face...

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (screaming) What hast thou done!? KATHERINE grabs THOMASIN’S HAIR and yanks her to her feet THOMASIN shrieks! She scrambles away from KATHERINE. KATHERINE looks at William’s corpse and the destroyed goa  98. shed, and THOMASIN stained with blood. KATHERINE’S face is empty. KATHERINE (CONT’D) Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I know not what I saw-

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I did nothing! She came from the sky - she -

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Devil! You have their blood upon thy hands! KATHERINE is half-laughing, half-crying: KATHERINE (CONT’D) It is you. It is you. THOMASIN runs rapidly toward the side of the house. KATHERINE follows her. THOMASIN stumbles over a basket of corn, she braces herse against the side of the house

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I am your daughter!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: The Devil is in thee and hath had thee. You are smeared of his sin. You reek of Evil. You have made a covenant with death!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Mother!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You bewitched thy brother, proud slut!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Stop it Mother.  Did 99.

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: you not think I saw thy sluttish looks to him, bewitching his eye as any whore?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: What say you to me?

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: And thy father next!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Mother!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You took them from me! They are gone!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: You killed my children! KATHERINE has clapboards. No! THOMASIN pressed right up against the

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: THOMASIN pushes her mother back. KATHERINE slaps her in the face! You

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: killed thy father! KATHERINE slaps and hits her. THOMASIN is forced down on the BENCH by the door. Let

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) go! Stop stop. I love you! Please, Mother I love you!

dialogues.speaker: KATHERINE
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Witch! WITCH!

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (overlapping) Stop it! Stop it! STOP IT! THOMASIN is struggling to get KATHERINE off of her but sh  100. can’t. KATHERINE is using all her force. THOMASIN reaches behind her, for something, anything.... The first thing t reaches her blind fingers is THE RUSTY BILLHOOK. THOMASIN unknowingly takes it up....

dialogues.speaker: SHE SWINGS IT AND SLASHES HER MOTHER IN THE HEAD
dialogues.text: KATHERINE gives a stunned look and BLOOD gushes from her wound. THOMASIN is in shock at what’s she’s done:

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Forgive me. Forgive me. Mother, mother- THOMASIN takes a step forward, BUT THEN KATHERINE STARTS

dialogues.speaker: STRANGLE THOMASIN
dialogues.text: She squeezes her hands tight around her daughter’s neck, turning red, trying to scream! THOMASIN TRIES TO GET HER MOTHER OFF OF HER! SHE CAN’T! KATHERINE KEEPS STRANGLING HER.

dialogues.speaker: SHE HACKS AGAIN, AND AGAIN UNTIL SHE CAN GET AWAY
dialogues.text: THOMASIN escapes from her mother’s clutches. KATHERINE collapses on THOMASIN. THOMASIN lies there with her mother’s heavy body on her. Pause. THOMASIN is shaking uncontrollably, breathing fast - adrenaline still coursing through her body. THE BILLHOOK drops out of her hand. She tries to move KATHERINE’S head, but it falls limp. KATHERINE is dead. Pause. THOMASIN lets out quiet, deeply mournful cry. She hugs her mother’s corpse. Tightly.  101. Pause. Then, slowly, slowly, the hug releases and THOMASIN’S fac begins to fall numb. Still trembling, on her back, THOMASIN crawls awkwardly o from under KATHERINE, pushing her mother off her. THOMASIN gets up and walks slowly, not looking at the bod She walks around the farmyard like a ghost. She looks out at THE OLD OAK TREE. Out to CALEB’S GRAVE. Pause. She is alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entering the house, THOMASIN takes off her bloody bodice skirt and leaves them on the floor. She takes a blanket from her parent’s bed and drapes it o her shoulders, covering her bloody shift. She sits at the table. She puts her head on the table. Empty. She closes her eyes. BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN wakes in the same position. All is dark in the house. The wind blows the door open an shut. Open and shut. Open... THOMASIN turns to the door. The blanket falls to the floo The door beckons her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN holds a lit taper and walks barefoot out into th night wearing only her shift. BLACK PHILLIP stands before her. Breath from his nostrils  102. catches the moonlight. The wind blows. BLACK PHILLIP walks into the shambles of THE GOAT SHED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMASIN holds the candle up to see BLACK PHILIP’S face. NOTE: CAMERA stays on THOMASIN (we never see BLACK PHILLI

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Black Phillip. I conjure thee to speak. Speak as thou dost speak to Jonas and Mercy. (pause. ) Dost thou understand my English tongue? Pause. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Answer me. Pause. Nothing. THOMASIN is truly alone. She turns her head and takes a step away.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK PHILLIP, (0.S)
dialogues.text: What dost thou want? THOMASIN tuns back, astonished:

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: What canst thou give?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK PHILLIP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wouldst thou like the taste of butter? A pretty dress? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BLACK PHILLIP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wouldst thou like to live deliciously? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK PHILLIP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wouldst thou like to see the world?

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: What will you from me?

dialogues.speaker: BLACK PHILLIP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dost thou see a book before thee? BLACK PHILLIP’S hooves step around a massive RED LEATHER BOOK. Centuries old. AS BLACK PHILLIP’S LEFT HOOF LEAVES FRAME, HIS RIGHT FOOT CROSSES, NOW IN THE SHAPE OF A GAUDY CAVALIER’S BOOT WITH JANGLING GOLD SPUR. THOMASIN looks up from the ground, back to BLACK PHILLIP’ face.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: Aye.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK PHILLIP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Remove thy shift. THOMASIN hesitates... she pulls the thin string on her sh awkwardly and child-like. She closes her eyes. She thinks is ready. She gives in. If falls off her body. (NOTE: WHILE “APPEARING” NUDE TO THE AUDIENCE, THOMASIN’S BREASTS, “ETC.” WILL NEVER BE IN FRAME.) THOMASIN hears THE SPURS jangle around her.

dialogues.speaker: THOMASIN
dialogues.text: I cannot write my name.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK PHILLIP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I will guide thy hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only glimpses of his face and gleams from his gold button and silk trimmings are seen.

dialogues.speaker: HIS SHINY LOCKS OF SABLE HAIR, COCKEREL FATHERS, AND BLAC
dialogues.text: LACE SLOWLY SHROUD THOMASIN’S FACE. BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE, CAMERA ON HER BACK: THOMASIN rides naked on the bac BLACK PHILLIP (a goat again), her hair falls freely behin her. They journey deep into THE WOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now within the wood, the “clickety-clackety” of broomstic flying through trees above their heads is heard. EXT. THE WITCH’S HOVEL - NIGHT AS THOMASIN emerges from the path, she sees a freakish si Half-visible in the darkness, still far from THOMASIN, ar dozen women: old women, women in their middle years, youn women - all grotesque - some humpbacks and cripples. All appear misshapen and distorted by the night. All of them filthy and nude or in strange patches and shreds of cloth They hold broomsticks, poles, distaffs and pitchforks. THE WITCHES DANCE, gyrating, shaking, and quivering in a trance-like reverie around a cauldron and fire in front o THE WITCH'S HOVEL. Depraved. Subhuman. Bestial. THOMASIN AND BLACK PHILLIP walk closer to the circle. WHEN THE COVEN OF WITCHES sees them, they shriek and cack with delight - their faces contort from their laughter. T WELCOME THOMASIN with their eyes. THOMASIN, still astride BLACK PHILLIP, smiles. SHE JOINS CIRCLE, laughing a little too, blushing... then laughs mo and more, WITH EVERY GROWING MOMENT HER SORROWS MELT AWAY

dialogues.speaker: VERY SLOWLY, AS THIS LAUGHTER INCREASES THE WITCHES BEGIN
dialogues.text: LEVITATE AROUND THE FIRE, rising on their brooms and pole
